title: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] Unable to open file in multiple editors (should display error message)
description: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] If file is already opened in one editor, cannot open in another editor (should give error message)
OB: When a file is already opened in one editor, and you try to open the same file in another editor by right-clicking on it and selecting 'Open With -> System Editor', nothing happens. There is no warning message displayed indicating that opening the file may overwrite changes. We believe this behavior is a safety feature where the editor does not allow external editing while the file is already opened in the editor.
EB: When a file is already opened in one editor, and you try to open the same file in another editor by right-clicking on it and selecting 'Open With -> System Editor', a warning message should be displayed indicating that opening the file may overwrite changes. The message should give an option to continue or cancel the action.
SR:
1. Ensure you have an associated Windows editor for your Java file. If not, go to the file explorer, double-click on any Java file, and select WordPad or Notepad as the default editor for all Java files.
2. Open the Java Perspective.
3. Right-click on a Java file.
4. Select 'Open With -> System Editor'.
5. Observe that nothing happens.
6. There should be a warning message displayed indicating that opening the file may overwrite changes. The message should provide an option to continue or cancel the action.
